title: Here’s how we picked this year’s Innovators Under 35
optimized_headline: Discover the selection process for this year's Innovators Under 35.
raw_excerpt: Next week, we’ll publish our 2025 list of Innovators Under 35, highlighting smart and talented people who are working in many areas of emerging technology. This new class features 35 accomplished founders, hardware engineers, roboticists, materials scientists, and others who are already tackling tough problems and making big moves in their careers. All are under…
raw_body: Next week, we’ll publish our 2025 list of Innovators Under 35, highlighting smart and talented people who are working in many areas of emerging technology. This new class features 35 accomplished founders, hardware engineers, roboticists, materials scientists, and others who are already tackling tough problems and making big moves in their careers. All are under…
speedrun: Next week, the 2025 list of Innovators Under 35 will be released, showcasing 35 talented individuals across various fields of emerging technology. These innovators include founders, engineers, and scientists who are addressing significant challenges in their industries. Their work is shaping the future and driving advancements in technology. This matters now as it highlights the next generation of leaders who could influence our technological landscape.
why_it_matters: This list offers recognition and visibility to young innovators, inspiring their peers and potential collaborators.
It reflects a broader trend of valuing innovation and entrepreneurship in technology, signaling a shift towards supporting fresh ideas and solutions.

lenses.eli12: The upcoming list of Innovators Under 35 celebrates young people making waves in tech. Think of it like a talent show for bright minds, where each participant shines in their own area. This matters because these innovators could create solutions that improve our daily lives and inspire others.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, the Innovators Under 35 list highlights emerging talent and fresh ideas that could address user needs. Understanding these innovators' work could inform product strategies and partnerships, ultimately leading to more efficient solutions in the market.
lenses.engineer: From a technical perspective, the Innovators Under 35 include hardware engineers and roboticists who are pushing the boundaries of technology. Their work may involve cutting-edge models and techniques that challenge existing benchmarks. Recognizing these innovators could lead to new collaborations that enhance engineering practices.
